titleInfo.title: PROHIBITING THE TRANSFER OF ANY DETAINEE AT UNITED STATES NAVAL STATION, GUANTANAMO BAY, CUBA

extension.searchTitle: PROHIBITING THE TRANSFER OF ANY DETAINEE AT UNITED STATES NAVAL STATION, GUANTANAMO BAY, CUBA; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 140

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Prohibiting the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba
Prohibiting the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5351, to prohibit the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, by a yea-and-nay vote of 244 yeas to 174 nays, Roll No. 520.

The House passed H.R. 5351, to prohibit the transfer of any individual detained at United States Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, by a yea-and-nay vote of 244 yeas to 174 nays, Roll No. 520.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment printed in part A of H. Rept. 114-744 shall be considered as adopted.

congVote.result: The bill (S. 2848), as amended, was passed, as follows:
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 95 yeas to 3 nays (Vote No. 141), Senate passed S. 2848, to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, to authorize the Secretary of the Army to construct various projects for improvements to rivers and harbors of the United States, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:
